```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)

```

```{r}
crime <- read_csv("data/us_crime_rates.csv")
crime

```


```{r}
crime %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=year, y=total)) + geom_line() + labs(x = "Year", y="Number of Crimes", title="Total Number of Crimes by Year") + scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1960,2020,4))

```
```{r}
crime1 <- data.frame(x=crime$year,
                y = c(crime$violent, crime$property),
                group = c(rep("violent", nrow(crime)),
                          rep("property", nrow(crime))))

ggplot(crime1, aes(x,y,col=group)) + geom_line() + scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1960,2020,4)) + scale_y_continuous(breaks=seq(0,50000000,1000000)) + labs(x="Years", y="Number of Crimes", title="Violent and Property Crimes By Year")
```
